statement:
The *quotient rule* says that the derivative of the quotient $f/g$ of
two differentiable functions $f$ and $g$ exists at all values of $x$ as
long as $g(x) \not= 0$ and is given by the formula

$$\frac{d}{dx}\ \left[\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\ \right] = 
\frac{g(x)f'(x) - f(x)g'(x)}{\lbrack g(x) \rbrack ^2}$$

The Quotient Rule and the other differentiation formulas allow us to
compute the derivative of any rational function.
